qas.question: What is the name of the Seventh-day Adventist's core beliefs?
What is used for justification of the 28 Fundamental Beliefs?
What belief about ultimate punishment do Adventists disagree on?

context: Although the Adventist churches hold much in common, their theologies differ on whether the intermediate state is unconscious sleep or consciousness, whether the ultimate punishment of the wicked is <a4_0>annihilation or eternal torment<a4_0/>, the nature of immortality, whether or not the wicked are resurrected after the millennium, and whether the sanctuary of Daniel 8 refers to the one in heaven or one on earth. The movement has encouraged the examination of <a0_0>the whole Bible<a0_0/>, leading <a1_0>Seventh-day Adventists and some smaller Adventist groups<a1_0/> to observe the Sabbath. The General Conference of Seventh-day Adventists has compiled that church's core beliefs in <a2_0>the 28 Fundamental Beliefs<a2_0/> (1980 and 2005), which use <a3_0>Biblical references<a3_0/> as justification.
